hero.title: Insights: write to think, then trade
hero.subtitle: Reading alone won’t change behavior. These articles are written as training prompts: define market context, clarify your claim, set falsification points, and decide what you will do if you’re wrong. The goal is to rebuild perception and execution first—so your strategy becomes a consequence of clarity, not a reaction to noise.
highlights: Pillar-based writing: Mind, Market, Price Action.
Each piece aims to end with an action checklist.
Falsification and pitfalls included to reduce self-deception.
hero.risk: Educational content only. Not investment advice; trading involves risk.
